meanings.definition: A device that emits a fine spray of liquid, especially for disinfecting or pest control.
meanings.sent1: The fogger sprayed a mist to kill the bugs in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I bought a fogger to get rid of the mosquitoes in our backyard.
meanings.sent3: The fogger went haywire and sprayed disinfectant all over the room!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a fogger, spreading rumors throughout the school.
meanings.sent5: The fogger hummed softly as it released the insect repellent into the air.

meanings.definition: A person who creates confusion or obscures the truth.
meanings.sent1: The politician was known as a fogger for his misleading statements.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to him; he's a fogger who twists the facts.
meanings.sent3: The fogger at the meeting kept changing his story, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fogger, clouded with deceit and half-truths.
meanings.sent5: He was a master fogger, able to distort reality with his words.
